title: Sudan Crisis
text: On April 15th, 2023, violent clashes erupted between the Sudanese Armed Forces (SAF) and the paramilitary Rapid Support Forces (RSF) in Sudan, resulting in the displacement of more than 10.2 million people, including internally displaced people (IDPs), asylum seekers and refugees. This conflict exacerbated many of Sudanâ€™s existing challenges, including ongoing conflicts, disease outbreaks, economic and political instability and climate emergencies.

title: Data Validation
text: The NIS TWG planned to conduct a data validation workshop from 26th to 28th Aug 2024 in Juba, South Sudan. All NIS TWG members are invited to participate and contribute!

title: Program Updates
text: This is a summary of 2024 people in need (PIN), cluster target and achievement in number, compared to PIN and target for the year as of July 2024. For more details on program update please refer to the update section and for more interactive experience check a this dashboard - https://ssd-nut-info.shinyapps.io/shiny/

title: IPC-AMN
text:
The Integrated Phase Classification of Acute Malnutrition (IPC AMN) provides key information for decision makers that focuses on short to long-term objectives to decrease acute malnutrition. Together with the IPC Acute Food Insecurity, the IPC Acute Malnutrition classification also provides information on acute food insecurity, making IPC an inclusive classification system to inform both acute food insecurity and acute malnutrition.
The 2024 IPC Analysis Workshop is scheduled to be held in Juba, South Sudan from Sept 10th to 25th 2024.

title: Welcome !
text:
Welcome to South Sudan Nutrition Information Systems Technical Working Group (NIS-TWG) page. NIS-TWG is one of the three TWG under the nutrition cluster that provides technical support to the government.
On this page, you will find dashboards, survey results, IPC-AMN results, data for download, NIS related guidelines & updates. Links to additional dashboards and reports are available for those who wish to explore the nutrition data in detail.

title: NuVAC
text: The Nutrition Vulnerabilities Assessment in Crisis (NuVAC) is a framework for nutrition analysis and a mechanism to facilitate a coordinated early warning system to prevent and respond to deterioration of nutrition situation.

title: NIS-TWG Meeting
text:
